channel.title: personal on Sørens Code|Speak
channel.description: Recent content in personal on Sørens Code|Speak

item.title: About
item.description: About My name is Søren K.S. Gregersen. I am an engineer schooled in physics and nanotechnology. I tried pursuing an academic career in nano electronics and later computer vision (see my old work at Google scholar). Now, however, I am employed as a imaging systems engineer in the medical industry. I consider myself a more-than-a-hobbyist programmer with many unfinished projects (see my random code at Github). About this blog This is where I collect my general thoughts on programming, languages, tools, and frameworks.

item.title: The ∨∑ (orsum) new toy language
item.description: Let me start this first post by explaining a little about what to expect in this blog. The ∨∑ (orsum) new toy language I am not a professional programmer. In fact, I have never finished any significant piece of software outside of small, closed, academic circles. I am a physicist. And I have written loads of one-off analysis software within mathematics, physics, and computer vision. I like programming. I enjoy trying new programming languages, just to see if they are more suited for various tasks.
